name: 洪媽益
objective: 本課程幫助學生習得敘述、描寫、推論、議論、省思、說明等文體方面的寫作技巧，並指導學生從閱讀、圖片、日常生活事件，及課堂討論內容中取材，以加強邏輯思考和流暢寫作能力。
schedule:
February 26 (Monday, moved from March 1), Class Orientation
March 5/12, Ch 2 Reading for the central idea
	Appendix, Ch 23 Articles
	Task: Find a topic and relevant articles, a story about the topic
March 19/26, Ch 3 Supporting the central idea
	Ch 9 Basic editing, Ch 10 Sentence fragments
	Task: Identify central idea and supporting data, defining the topic
April 2/9, Ch 4 Unity and coherence
	Chs 17~22 Punctuation and mechanics
April 16/23, Ch 5 Summarizing and responding to reading
	Ch 11 Fused sentences and comma splices
	Ch 12 Verb tense and voice
April 30/May 14, Ch 6 Evaluating reading selections
	Ch 13 Subject-Verb agreement
	Ch 14 Pronoun agreement and reference
May 21/28, Synthesizing ideas from reading selections
	Ch 15 Pronoun case
	Ch 16 Misplaced and dangling modifiers
June 4/11, Oral presentations
June 25, papers due
END
scorePolicy:
Final paper/presentation: 20%/20% (Final papers containing more than five basic grammatical errors will be given a FAIL)
Weekly homework: 30%
Seat work and quizzes: 30%
materials:
McDonald, Stephen and William Salomone. 2012. The writer's response: A reading-based approach to writing. Boston: Cengage. 978-0-495-90626-1
Handouts
